title: Can I run two different versions of Firefox at the same time?
content: If I can run two different versions of Firefox at the same time on one computer, how do I install the previous version?
creator: markfleener

title: Firefox tabs and windows
content: When I click a link either form a web page or from an email I get a whole new window rather than a new tab in the existing Firefox window. This new window is stripped back without the usual menu of options at the top. Is this EDGE taking over my life? I have Firefox as my default browser.
creator: jamestyas

title: Carpeta y fichero con el mismo nombre
content: Cuando un fichero de página WEB, por ejemplo "modelo.html", está contenido en una carpeta con el mismo nombre, es decir "modelo", Firefox no funciona correctamente al ejecutar "modelo.html" porque las instrucciones css no se cargan correctamente. Sin embargo, otros navegadores si lo hacen correctamente. Lo resolví cambiando el nombre de la carpeta, pero pienso que eso no debería estar pasando.
creator: eperezperez63

title: Pure Web Browser
content:
Hello, yesterday (Friday) I downloaded the program Pure Web Browser, which was one of the advertisement on Firefox website when I opened it. Later, I discovered that Pure Browser was blocking many things, because I could not perform functions on some websites, such as getting my email because it blocked me signing in. This happened with several sites.

Could you please tell me how to delete Pure Web Browser, as it is causing problems with the PC. I have tried, and had no success.

Thanks for your help.

Dianne
creator: dyannia

title: Restriting RAM being used by Firefox
content: Firefox is my default browser however if find that it does demand a significant amount of RAM whilst running for example today it is running 800 Mb with only 5 tabs open but earlier it was using 1200 Mb. This demand is slowing down my computer as other programmes are being impacted. Is there any way of restricting or limiting the amount of RAM being used by Firefox. Currently it is normally at the top of programmes using the greatest amount of RAM.
creator: martin-wilkins-it

title: Can't log in
content:
Hi , I can't log on to The Times & Sunday Times site and get the error message Secure Connection Failed The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified. I could log on no problem before 2 days ago now can't . I can log on no problem on Chrome , help please.

Kind regards , Dave.
creator: davemcwilliams50

title: My account and my brother's merged because we used once the same laptop.
content:
Hello; so, my brother lend me his old laptop, clean. I signed in firefox with my account and explore normally. One day, he need it back a couple days so he can work while he repairs his main machine. Log off of my account and log on in his. Now my bookmarks, historial, loggins, etc appear in his session. We think that can not be possible with separate accounts with different associated e-mail and passwords, but here we are.

There is a way to separate my things from his account? It only happens to him, i don't have in my browser his data. Thanks
creator: Vilem_Landerer

title: I cannot update beyond 120.0.
content: I cannot update beyond 120.0. This is the last version that did update right. With posterior versions (i.e. 122.0), after downloaded the packet, shows "applying update" continuosly until I close the program. My system is a 64 bit Windows 10 Pro 22H2
creator: Guillermo_SG

title: 'Combine taskbar buttons and hide labels' set to 'Never' not working correctly in Windows 11 in conjunction with Firefox
content: Hi. When Windows 11 was initially released, certain substantial feature of the Windows taskbar known from before was missing. I'm talking about 'Combine taskbar buttons and hide labels' and the option to set it to 'Never' (users tend to set it this way to always see the program icon along with it's label, not just the icon). At this moment, the feature has been available in widely released build of Windows 11 for months (Microsoft returned it after rewriting the taskbar code and after many complains), but it is not working correctly in conjunction with Firefox. When I close all windows and tabs of Firefox and restart the browser, only its icon is visible on the taskbar, not the label. Only when I open one more Firefox window, it starts to work as it should. Is it a known issue? Can we expect a fix to be made soon? Thanks.
creator: andrewz1986

title: Suspect warning about using Firefox.
content: 02/09/2024. For the past 4 or 5 days I've been getting a warning not to proceed any search on Firefox. Here's part of the message: "Warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead Firefox detected a potential security threat and did not continue to resultsvlt.com. If you visit this site, attackers could try to steal information like your passwords, emails, or credit card details. What can you do about it? The issue is most likely with the website, and there is nothing you can do to resolve it. You can notify the website’s administrator about the problem. " xfinity is the service provider and I live in Olympia, WA." Please advise.
creator: 1234ariariari

title: must sign into all websites everyday
content: firefox won't remember my username and passwords for msn or yahoo. must sign in everytime i try to use them.
creator: melvindiller

title: Multiple processes
content: What can I do to reduce the number of open processes to speed up performance?
creator: ryderdrumr

title: Unblocking websites
content: All of a sudden I can't open a certain website. I opened the website a few days ago with no problem and have been using the site for years. (I checked to see if the site is down but it's not.) I googled how to unblock websites in Firefox and nothing I've tried works. I disabled Trackers for the website and I cleared my Cookies. I added the Firefox uBlock extension a few weeks ago to stop constant website popups (after I tried resetting Firefox) and I turned uBlock off for this certain website but I still can't access the website. I also installed Mozilla VPN last week. I'm using Firefox 122.0.1. What could be the problem?
creator: grov10

title: Cannot see comments at many blogs, eg. Instapundit, Breitbart, etc

title: Firefox
content: Firefox showed up when I was working online asking to select them for start-up every time I sign in? How do I know whether this is Firefox or some scam?
creator: daisy72FIRE

title: Default browser on linux fails on file:/// URLs.
content:
I just wrote this blog post and someone suggested I contact you.

I have my default browser set to Firefox on Linux (Debian Bookworm). When I open an http:// or https:// URL, it opens in Firefox, but when I open a file:/// URL, it opens in Chromium. It seems that file:/// URL makes it resort to the MIME type.

Is there anything Firefox can do here or is this a Debian or freedesktop.org issue?

Thanks!

Tim
creator: theaney

title: Have new Mac Mini computer with Sonoma 14.3.1 with Rosetta
content:
I'm trying to install & use Firefox as my browser of choice on this new computer. Using the migration assistant, Firefox seemed to transfer to the new computer with no problem, except that it did not work. Neither does, apparently a new installation directly on the Mac Mini. Any suggestions? I do prefer to remain with the new operating system if possible

Thanks,


Wes Sokolosky
creator: wessokolosky

title: What is the story behind the "Copy Link Without Site Tracking" contextual menu item?
content:
In what scenario would anyone ever want a website to track what they are copying? Why would a browser allow a website to see what you're copying anyway?

Not only that, it takes up precious real-estate in an often already-crowded contextual menu. Why not make it the default action when selecting the normal "Copy Link" contextual menu item?
creator: harrison.bergmann

title: disabling firefox's native pdf viewer
content:
Using v115.7 in debian 12.

I prefer to open pdf files with the default viewer in the operating system, not on a firefox browser tab. I have gone into settings->general->applications and configured selected "Use system default application" for PDF files. If I click on a pdf file it downloads to my Downloads folder, which is the usual and preferred behaviour. If I click the downloaded files icon on firefox's toolbar, I see the file I downloaded, all good. If I open the folder with all downloaded files, and click on the file, it opens in the OS's default viewer, all good. On the other hand, if I click on the downloaded files icon on firefox's toolbar and simply select the downloaded file from the displayed list, it opens on a firefox browser tab. This is driving me bananas. How do I configure firefox to launch the default system application instead?
creator: zapstrap
